post_text: Check this out!
shared_text:
Laura Krier
March 12, 2019 at 11:02 AM ·

Count down to Father Daughter Dance March 22nd 6:00-9:00pm at the Armory!! Take your favorite little lady to a dance of her own!! Get your tickets ASAP!! Also here are the raffle items that will be raffled off at the dance for girls to win!!! Get your tickets at Bright Beginnings Pre School, Fusions downtown or Coldwell Banker anytime during the day if you want one reserved just message me or Bobbie Kay McWhorter or Jenna Wise!! Thank you for your support we enjoy putting this event on for our very own little ladies and for our baseball teams to give back to our community for their support!! 😍❤️!!

October 25, 2018 at 7:13 AM ·

The USD 224 Clifton-Clyde Eagles for Excellence in Education (E3) Parent Group, along with the Clifton-Clyde FFA Alumni Association, will sponsor their 4th Annual Haunted Hay Rack Saturday night at Hartman's Farm, located at 632 Deer Road in Clifton. Discover more at NCKToday.com

shared_text:
Clifton-Clyde Sharpshooters
April 13, 2018 at 10:12 AM ·

The trap team is currently seeking donations to help with costs of shells for the season! If you’d like to donate or know of someone interested in helping out our team, please let Arika or Mistie know.

The Cloud County Foundation grant applied for was denied. We will be looking to sell chances on a gun soon to help with costs.

In the future, we will also be setting up a Memorial Squirrel Hunt. Be on the look out during squirrel season.

shared_text:
USD 224 Clifton-Clyde
December 18, 2017 at 1:43 PM ·

The Board of USD 224 is looking for a qualified candidate to fill the unexpired term for Board Position 6. This term will expire January, 2020. Qualified candidates must live in the following area: rural area outside the city limits of Clifton, Clyde and Vining south of Kansas 9 and Parallel Road east of Kansas 15 and Kansas 9, except for Mulberry Township east of Clay County 827 and north of the Republican River; and that portion of the City of Clyde south of Washington Street, east of Railroad, south of Kennedy, and east of Borton Streets.

Any interested candidate should contact Art Baker or Denise Cyr (Board Clerk) at the district office (785-446-2098). The deadline for applications is 3:00pm, January 4, 2018

post_text:
Teacher Christmas Gifts
There will be angel trees for grade school & middle school teachers in the middle school hallway on November 28. If you'd like to purchase a Christmas gift for your child's teacher, please pick an angel off of their tree on your way to drop your child off in the gym for the concert. These are items that the teachers need for their classrooms. Your child can bring this gift for their teacher before the Holiday break in December. Thank you!

shared_text:
USD 224 Clifton-Clyde
October 11, 2017 at 3:59 PM ·

There has been some confusion as to where Centre High School is located. Please understand that Centre High School is a rural public high school located 5 miles south of Lost Springs and 2 miles north of Lincolnville along U.S. Highway 77/Highway 56. It is east of this highway. It is NOT located in the towns of Lost Springs or Lincolnville.

shared_text:
CCHS NHS
October 10, 2017 at 10:57 AM ·

The Martinez family recently lost their home in a fire. The Clifton-Clyde NHS chapter is wanting to help them rebuild their lives by collecting donations of school supplies, clothing, hygiene items, non-perishable groceries, money, and words of kindness. If you have anything you would like to give to the Martinez family, please bring it to Mrs. Junek's classroom by Thursday.

Thank You!

shared_text:
USD 224 Clifton-Clyde
September 15, 2017 at 4:07 PM ·

Starting Monday, CCMS will offer students a quick grab and go breakfast at the Middle School for grades 4-6. Breakfast will be served before school starts in the inside concession area. Items served will include pop tarts, cinnamon rolls, muffins, juice, milk, and other quick breakfast foods. Each breakfast will meet Kan-Eat regulations and will cost the normal breakfast cost. For any student wanting the normal breakfast, they can still eat at CCGS.
